pr_title: Remove TurnWeighting and handle turn weights within Weighting instead

timeline.message: Calculate turn costs via TurnCostProvider within AbstractWeighting
Add constructor with TurnCostProvider argument to the other weightings as well
Start removing usages of TurnWeighting, 29 left
Remove TurnWeighting and QueryGraphTurnCostStorage, add QueryGraphWeighting
Set up turn cost providers when creating weightings for edge-based CH profiles
Move u_turn_costs parameter from CHProfile into (default) turn cost provider
Use Strings to add CH profiles to GraphBuilder
Fix or downgrade some of the remaining todos

timeline.bodyText: Yes, this is intended. In a separate issue we could try if this would have any negative consequences.
timeline.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText: Should we create an issue as reminder for this?
timeline.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't it include the FlagEncoder too? Because without it, then different providers will have the same name.
(and in weighting.matches we could adapt the equals)
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Hmm, the FlagEncoder belongs to the Weighting and the DefaultTurnCostProvider in a way.. Right now its included in the Weighting name only (and it probably always has to be the same).
replies.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: I see, this would be a bit of a circular dependency then. Still it feels strange that there will be different turn cost providers with the same name as soon as multiple vehicles are imported.
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText:
Hmm yes this is not ideal. DefaultTurnCostProvider and AbstractWeighting are both using a FlagEncoder (and it most likely always has to be the same), so maybe the most correct way to assign the names would be using the FlagEncoder name for both? But then the weighting name would be something like car|fastest|car|40, which seems bad as well.

here will be different turn cost providers with the same name

Maybe the question here is a turn cost provider is something that can exist without a weighting?
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should avoid instantiating this provider and create a singleton from it? Or even remove this class and create a variable "NO_TURN_COST" in TurnCostProvider?
timeline.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText:
Do you think this is required? (similar question applies to the method where you kept the CH file names compatible)
We never kept backward compatibility for our files as they are recreated due to every OSM data update. I do not see value until we officially support offline routing support (maybe something for 3.0 ;) )
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Its probably not required because (?) I kept the old file names. I thought it would be ugly to change the filenames now and then change them again soon in #1708. Do you want to remove this complexity and just change the filenames now also? Otherwise we probably do not need to change the data versions, but I left this comment to double check.
replies.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: With my most recent commits this PR should be compatible with current master. On the other hand there is string manipulation logic to achieve this. I think its ok like this and this will be changed with #1708 again. If you prefer removing the string manipulation and not being compatible this is also totally fine for me.
replies.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: 👍 I have no strong opinion here :)
replies.author: karussell

timeline.message: Use a static constant for NoTurnCostProviders

timeline.bodyText: Any opinion here? Its no longer easy to do this check, we would need something like weighting.hasTurnCosts() (and maybe check if TurnCostProvider is a NoTurnCostProvider. But that doesn't seem very clean. Also using a TurnCostProvider and then choosing nodeBased is not necessarily an error (but might be useful to receive a warning...).
timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: I removed the check, it would be nice to have, but not really important either imo.
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: Similar question here. But maybe we even want edge-based without turn costs for some(?) reason. #1702
timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: I removed the check, here I actually think it'd be bad to do it because of #1702.
replies.author: easbar

timeline.message: Remove todo about checking edge/node based
